tn.text: Here "hand of Moses" refers to the scriptures that Moses wrote down. AT: "through the things that Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This happens when a person accidentally kills another person, without intending to do so.

tn.ref: avenge the blood of a person who was killed
tn.text: Here the shed blood of a person represents their death. This can be stated in active form. AT: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here the word "he" refers to the person who unintentionally killed someone.

tn.ref: explain his case to the elders of that city
tn.text: "convince the elders of that city that he had not intentionally killed the person.
The word "they" refers to the elders and "him" refers to the person who unintentionally killed someone.
This refers to the city as a whole, not to the elders only.

tn.ref: avenge the blood of the person who was killed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:20:01|20:3]]. AT: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: killed his neighbor unintentionally ... accidentally killed the person
tn.text: These phrases mean the same thing.
This is a phrase that describes standing to seek justice from a court of the assembly of his fellow citizens.
There are a lot of names in this section. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is a short name for the Jordan River.

tn.ref: would not die by the hand of the one
tn.text: Here "by the hand" means that this person would be the direct agent who killed the fugitive. AT: "would not be killed by the one" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: avenge the blood that was shed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:20:01|20:3]]. AT: "avenge a person's death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
